section.name: How to start?
section.p: genesis was conceived having as a goal to make development easier and faster. In order to allow someone to use it in an easier and faster way, we made available a whole empty project structure, so you just need to code your own classes. All compilation and installations process are already configured in this empty web project.
It's extremely important you have already read genesis docs and understood its concepts and features. Before starting to code, read the User Manual and understand genesis distribution jars.

We call an empty web project strutucture empty-web-project and it comes with genesis-empty-web-project distribution or genesis-all distribution. This structure can be found in dir <GENESIS_DISTRIBUTION>/samples/empty-web-project/.

ul.li: genesis distribution along its dependency libraries.
JBoss server. We recommend a 3.2.x release.
To compile and install the application we recommend Apache Ant 1.6.x.

section.name: Configuring a new project
section.p: You can copy the whole empty-web-project structure to a development directory of your choice. The first step to configure a new project is to copy the file named build.properties.sample to a new one named build.properties. File build.properties defines certain proprerties that are project or developer specific. The initial content for build.properties.sample is as follows:
section.source:
## Build properties sample
# The following property must be defined in build.properties with an appropriate # value for the local environment jboss.home=/opt/jboss-3.2.6 genesisBasedApplication.name=empty-web-project genesisBasedApplication.prettyName=Empty Web Project
# These properties already have a default value defined in build.xml and only # need to be defined in build.properties if their values are different in your # local setup #genesis.home=../../genesis #xdoclet.dist=../../xdoclet/dist #jboss.datasource.jndi.name=java:/DefaultDS #jboss.datasource.config.xml=${jboss.home}/server/default/deploy/hsqldb-ds.xml #hibernate.dialect=net.sf.hibernate.dialect.HSQLDialect #hibernate.version=2.1.6 #hibernate.show.sql=true #hibernate.session.factory.jndi.name=jboss:/hibernate/SessionFactory #hibernate.jboss.service.name=HibernateFactory,name=HibernateFactory
section.p: At least three properties must be defined:

ul.li: jboss.home: Indicates where JBoss 3.2.x is installed
genesisBasedApplication.name: Choose a name for your project, preferably with no spaces in it.
genesisBasedApplication.prettyName: Defines a descriptive name for your project. This name may contain spaces.

section.p: There are other optional properties that have got a default value, but may be redefined. Some of them are:

ul.li: genesis.home: Indicates where genesis is located. Usually this directory will be something like < SOME_DIRECTORY>/genesis-<version>/genesis
jboss.datasource.config.xml: Indicates the JBoss datasource config file location. You can supply another config file that matches your database configuration.

hibernate.dialect: Indicates what SQL dialect Hibernate will use. If you're going to use any database other than HSQLDB, you must supply the correct dialect. You can find further information about how to configure dialects at the Hibernate site.

section.p: To make understanding easier, let's imagine a cenario for a new genesis based project creation:

ul.li: We have JBoss 3.2.6 installed at C:\servers\jboss-3.2.6
We install genesis dist at C:\projects, what creates a C:\projects\genesis-<version> dir.
The project will be calledhelloworld and its descriptive name will be Hello World.
The main project class will be exemplo.HelloWorld.

section.name: Developing with genesis
section.p: There are two source dirs in the project:

ul.li: <PROJECT_DIR>/modules/web/src: Dir that contains all source files related to the web side of your application (servlets, context listeners, and other classes related to the view tier).

<PROJECT_DIR>/modules/shared/src: Dir that contains all source files that both the web side and the ejb container side will need. Generally classes that represent business logic and have transactional/remotable methods (Commands) are put there. Together with them, we have what we call Databeans, i.e., Hibernate mapped objects, named that way since they go from the view layer to the persistence layer.

section.p: Another web dir can be found at <PROJECT_DIR>/modules/web/content and must contains html, jsp, javascript, pics, xml and other files that usually are part of war files.
The last dir is <PROJECT_DIR>/modules/web/lib where you should put jars related to your web-tier, such as struts.jar (if you are using struts).

section.name: Compiling and installing your application
section.p: The project can be compiled and installed on JBoss using Ant.
To compile and install your application we have the following basic Ant targets:

ul.li: all: Compiles, packages and deploys your application
clean: Deletes all files generated during compilation.
clean-build: It does the same as running clean and all in sequence.

section.p:
The faster way to put your project to run is:
ant all <JBOSS_DIR>/bin/run -c <genesisBasedApplication.name>
So, go to your application url, i.e: http://localhost:8080/<genesisBasedApplication.name>
